channel.title: Help changing ip on 317 client
channel.description: hi, this is my first post on here, and the only reason i'm posting is because i can't get my server online. i know there are several places where you have to change an ip from either 127.0.0.1 or localhost to my no-ip that i've set up. i've already portforwared 43594 and checked it. i'm not sure where to change the port for it either, so maybe that's what's wrong. can anyone tell me the exact places where i have to put my ip and maybe where to change the port that it uses?

item.title: Help changing ip on 317 client
item.dc:creator: @Exstasy Exstasy
item.description:
@Exstasy wrote:

Go to client.java and search for

what ever is behind the = sign should be 127.0.0.1 but if it isn’t. change it to your no-ip

gl

Read full topic

item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

vascro:

no, it’s still not working. i changed everything that i could in client.java. any other suggestions?

if that no-ip adress isnt working… then your server isn’t online.

item.title: Help changing ip on 317 client
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

If you’re trying to run it yourself, you’re not supposed to put in your no-ip… if i’m correct, you put in your IPv4 Adress.

Goto start, search, “cmd”, the type “ipconfig” Then look for IPv4, and use that.

Read full topic

in client.java search for

item.title: Help changing ip on 317 client
item.dc:creator: @vascro vascro
item.description:
@vascro wrote:

/*server = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "earthrealms.no-ip.biz:"); System.out.println("Set server to: " + server + "");*/ try { String sServer = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "earthrealms.no-ip.biz:"); server = sServer; sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(sServer)); } catch(Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }
that’s in the gui.java file. note, earthrealms.no-ip.biz is the ip i’m trying to use for the server. it still doesn’t work. any other places? also, the client i’m using doesn’t have a place for the ip or port on the interface when it’s open.

Read full topic

item.title: Help changing ip on 317 client

item.description:
@Adobe wrote:

if your using PI base then go into client-file<client.java<search server = "127.0.0.1" ^usually the default IP, and then possibly in the GUI.java.
